meanings.definition: Moist with or as if with dew.
meanings.sent1: The grass was dewy in the morning, glistening with moisture.
meanings.sent2: Her skin looked dewy after applying the hydrating lotion.
meanings.sent3: The dewy grass seemed to sparkle like a field of tiny diamonds.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden appeared dewy, as if nature had painted them with morning mist.
meanings.sent5: The dewy leaves on the trees made the whole forest feel enchanted.

meanings.sent1: Her dewy eyes reflected innocence and purity.
meanings.sent2: The morning air was cool and dewy, invigorating the senses.
meanings.sent3: The dewy morning reminded him of the fresh start each day brings.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a dewy breeze, refreshing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The dewy petals of the flower looked as if they had just been kissed by the morning sun.
